document_title: Hemorrhagic cystitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_content:
1. Use antibiotics and pain relievers
Hemorrhagic cystitis caused by infection can be treated with antibiotics. In case the patient has symptoms that are not too serious, the doctor will also prescribe this treatment method.; Antibiotics, commonly known as amoxicillin, ciprofloxacin and nitrofurantoin are drugs used to inhibit the growth of bacteria inside the bladder. In some necessary cases, the doctor will also prescribe painkillers for the patient to relieve the pain.; It should be noted that when treating hemorrhagic cystitis with antibiotics and painkillers, you need to follow the dosage prescribed by your doctor. Patients must not arbitrarily stop treatment when symptoms improve or disappear. Using antibiotics incorrectly will negatively affect the body's immune system and reduce drug response in future treatments.
2. Surgery
People with hemorrhagic cystitis, if there is heavy bleeding or large blood clots, blocking the bladder, the doctor will remove the blood clots with a specialized catheter.; On the other hand, the treatment of bleeding in the bladder can also stop the bleeding with electric current or laser fulguration. To perform this method, the doctor will use a cystoscope inserted into the patient's bladder to determine the bleeding location that needs to be treated before performing hemostasis.; Cystectomy or cystectomy is the final treatment. Applicable to serious cases with high pain intensity and heavy bladder bleeding but the patient does not respond or responds poorly to other treatments.
See also: Chronic cystitis
